net.sourceforge.waters.analysis.comp552

Class ControllabilityCounterExampleChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sourceforge.waters.analysis.comp552.ControllabilityCounterExampleChecker

  • public class ControllabilityCounterExampleChecker
extends Object

    A tool to check whether a controllability counterexample is a correct counterexample to show that a given product DES is not controllable.

    To use this class, an instance must be obtained from the constructor. Afterwards, checkCounterExample() can be called repeatedly. If a check fails, getDiagnostics() can be called to retrieve an explanation.

    ControllabilityCounterExampleChecker checker = new ControllabilityCounterExampleChecker();
    if (checker.checkCounterExample(des, trace)) {
      System.out.println("OK");
    } else {
      String msg = checker.getDiagnostics();
      System.out.println(msg);
    }

    Author:
    Robi Malik

    • Method Detail

      • checkCounterExample

        public boolean checkCounterExample(ProductDESProxy des,
                                   CounterExampleProxy counter)
                            throws AnalysisException
        Checks a controllability error trace.
        Parameters:
        des - The product DES that was verified.
        counter - The counterexample to be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the given counterexample demonstrates that the given product DES is not controllable, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        AnalysisException - to indicate a problem while attempting to verify the counterexample.

      • getDiagnostics

        public String getDiagnostics()
